Package tournamentmanager.core.api

Interface TournamentTreeBuilder

All Known Implementing Classes:
TournamentTreeBuilderImpl
public interface TournamentTreeBuilder
Set of services to build the Tournament tree from a list of participants.

A Tournament tree is composed of a list of rounds, each round composed of a list of games.

Except for the final Game, each Game is connected to a Game of the next round. When a participant wins in a Game, he or she goes to the following Game in the next round.

  • Method Details

    • buildAllRounds

      List<List<Game>> buildAllRounds​(List<Participant> participants) throws TournamentException
      Build a complete Tournament tree for all rounds of the Tournament, using a list of participants.

      A Tournament tree is simply a list of rounds. Since a round is a list of Games, a Tournament tree is a list of lists of Games.

      See buildInitialRound() regarding how the first round is built, and buildNextRound() regarding how all other round is built.

      Parameters:
      participants - The list with all participants.
      Returns:
      The complete tournament tree.
      Throws:
      TournamentException - If the amount of players is so high that the resulting tournament size is higher than Integer.MAX_VALUE.

    • buildInitialRound

      List<Game> buildInitialRound​(List<Participant> participants) throws TournamentException
      Build the first round of a tournament tree. This first round is special because it is initially filled with all participants.
      Parameters:
      participants - The list with all participants.
      Returns:
      The initial round of the tournament tree.
      Throws:
      TournamentException - If the amount of players is so high that the resulting tournament size is higher than Integer.MAX_VALUE.

    • buildNextRound

      List<Game> buildNextRound​(List<? extends Game> previousRound)
      Given an already created round, build the next round of a tournament tree.

      Each Game of this next round is connected to two Games from the previous round.

      Parameters:
      previousRound - The round that precedes this newly created round.
      Returns:
      The round that follows the given previous round.
